concept.title: Event
concept.shortdesc: A tracked activity. An event is also called a success event. It is defined as a point on your website in which a successful conversion occurs. For example, if a product is added to the customer’s shopping cart, the scAdd event is used to capture that success event. Think of events as conversion metrics.

conbody.p: Adobe offers both Predefined Events and Custom Events. The Predefined Events are related to retail conversions and have specific names (discussed later in the chapter). Custom Events can be used for any purpose and are commonly used for conversion activities such as registrations, subscriptions, downloads, form completions, sign- ups, and so on. They can even be used in a retail solution to fill in gaps in the checkout process that go beyond what is provided with the Predefined Events.
See events in the Implementation Guide.
